title: Black Forest Cake II
description: Indulge in the classic richness of Black Forest Cake II, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in Kirsch liqueur and layered with sweet Bing cherries and fluffy whipped cream. This elegant dessert combines deep chocolate flavors with a hint of cherry and a velvety finish that will delight any crowd.
ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until combined.
Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
Divide batter evenly between the two prepared pans and smooth the tops.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool cakes completely in pans, then remove parchment paper.
Cut each cake layer horizontally in half to make 4 layers total.
Sprinkle each layer evenly with 1/2 cup kirschwasser.
In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Add confectioners' sugar, a pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth.
If filling is too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk to reach spreadable consistency.
Spread one-third of the filling on the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries.
Repeat layering with remaining cake layers, filling, and cherries.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake for garnish.
tips: For the best texture, ensure the cake layers are completely cooled before slicing and soaking with kirschwasser to prevent crumbling. Use fresh heavy cream and whip it just to stiff peaks for a light, airy frosting. Avoid overbaking the cake to keep it moist and tender.

structured_content.content: Experience the magic of Black Forest Cake II, where rich chocolate layers meet the bright tartness of Bing cherries soaked in Kirschwasser. This cake is a feast for the senses, combining moist texture, luscious cream, and a hint of cherry liqueur that makes every bite unforgettable.

structured_content.content: This recipe reminds me of cozy holiday gatherings, where the aroma of chocolate and cherries filled the air and everyone eagerly awaited the first slice. It’s a timeless dessert that brings warmth and joy to any table.

• Main ingredient: Use high-quality unsweetened cocoa powder for deep chocolate flavor and fresh Bing cherries for authentic tartness and sweetness.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Kirschwasser adds a subtle cherry liqueur note that elevates the cake’s complexity; vanilla extract enhances the overall aroma.
  • Supporting ingredients: Buttermilk tenderizes the cake, while confectioners' sugar and coffee enrich the filling’s texture and taste.
  • Equipment needed: Two 8-inch round cake pans, mixing bowls, electric mixer, parchment paper, and a potato peeler for chocolate curls.

Preparation:
Preheat the oven and prepare pans with parchment paper. Sift dry ingredients to ensure even mixing. Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy for a light cake texture.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Alternate adding dry ingredients and buttermilk to maintain batter moisture. Bake until a toothpick comes out clean, then cool completely before slicing to avoid crumbling. Soak layers with kirschwasser for moistness and flavor infusion.
Finishing Touches:
Prepare the buttercream filling and spread evenly with cherries between layers. Whip cream with vanilla and kirschwasser for frosting, then garnish with delicate chocolate curls for an elegant presentation.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use room temperature ingredients for smooth batter and filling.
  • Don’t overbake the cake to keep it moist and tender.
  • Look for a clean toothpick test and a springy top to confirm doneness.
  • Store the cake covered in the refrigerator and consume within 3 days for best freshness.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cake with loved ones always brings smiles and creates lasting memories. Its rich flavors and elegant layers make it a centerpiece dessert that everyone looks forward to.

Enhance the cake by adding a splash of cherry juice to the filling for extra moisture, or sprinkle toasted almonds between layers for crunch. Fresh mint leaves or a dusting of cocoa powder on top add a refreshing contrast.
Serve slices with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a glass of chilled cherry wine. This cake pairs beautifully with coffee or black tea, making it perfect for afternoon gatherings or festive dinners.

For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can use coconut cream instead of heavy cream and a plant-based butter substitute. Experiment with different berries or liqueurs to create unique twists.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Beat shortening and sugar until very light for a tender crumb.
  • Gently fold in dry ingredients to avoid overmixing and tough cake.
  • Chill the cake layers briefly before slicing to get clean, even cuts.
  • Use a hot knife to slice the cake smoothly without tearing.

structured_content.content: With this recipe, you’ll gain confidence in creating a stunning, flavorful Black Forest Cake that impresses every time. Enjoy the process and savor the delicious results with those you love!
